issues.description: HTTP verb for creating persons is inconsistent between the problem statement and the provided solution. The problem statement explicitly requires POST /persons for creating a new Person (see problem statement lines describing endpoints). In the reference solution the create endpoint is implemented with @PutMapping("persons") (server) and the client uses WebClient.put() when adding a person. This mismatch will confuse students: they will (reasonably) implement a POST endpoint and a client that uses POST as requested by the assignment, but the solution and provided reference tests expect a PUT-based create endpoint. This is a structural API contract mismatch that can prevent the student's implementation from matching the solution/tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the API contract. Prefer the HTTP semantics described in the problem statement: change the reference solution (server and client) to use POST for creating a new person. Concretely, update the server mapping to @PostMapping("persons") and change the client to use webClient.post().uri("persons") for addPerson. Alternatively, if PUT is intentional for creating persons, update the problem statement to state that creation uses PUT /persons instead of POST /persons so students implement the same contract.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies the creation endpoint as POST /persons, and the template's client-side TODO asks for an HTTP POST for creating a person. In the solution code both the server and client implement creation using HTTP PUT (server: PersonResource.createPerson is annotated with @PutMapping("persons"); client: PersonController.addPerson uses WebClient.put()). This is an unintended semantic mismatch for the same conceptual operation (create person). Students following the problem/template instructions (expecting POST) will be confused when the provided solution uses PUT — the HTTP method differs for the same action, breaking a clear one-to-one mapping between requirement and implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the HTTP method used for creating a Person across artifacts. Prefer following the problem statement: change the server-side createPerson mapping to @PostMapping("persons") and update the client to use WebClient.post() for addPerson. Alternatively, if PUT is intended for creation, update the problem statement and template comments to specify PUT instead of POST — but keep server and client consistent with the documented requirement.
